name: The Logic of Social Inquiry
description: Logic of Social Inquiry compares the logic of quantitative and qualitative research. Key topics include the relationship between theory and research, conceptualization and measurement of sociological concepts and sampling strategies in the quantitative and qualitative traditions. Students are introduced to a range of data collection methods. Students are required to take this course upon entry to the Sociology and Criminology, Law and Society Major and Specialist programs. [24L, 12T]
exclusions: SOC200Y5, SOC200Y1, SOC200H1, SOCB05H3, SOC150H1 + SOC204H1
